result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A. Heinze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Lafayette County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in Anger Management counseling and follow through with all recommendations thereof.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Angela K. Heinze.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay balance due of $295.51.

Defendant is sentenced to 60 days in the Lafayette County Jail concurrent with Count 2 and concurrent with sentence in case 17-CM-33.  Defendant shall be allowed Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2 and sentence in case 17-CM-33.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2 and sentence in case 17-CM-33.

records.addlTxt: Case called at 4:30 PM.  Defendant Timothy A. Heinze in court, in custody, with attorney Glenn Edward Avena.  Jenna Gill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Avena files Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form.  Court questions Defendant regarding Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form.  Court questions Attorney Avena regarding Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form.  Court is satisfied Defendant enters his plea knowingly, freely, voluntarily, and intelligently, accepting Defendant's plea of No Contest, adjudicating Defendant Guilty.  State requesting recommendations.  Attorney Avena makes a statement to the Court.  Mr. Heinze makes a statement to the Court.  Court will Order recommendation.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Check from DOC in the amount of $156.49
Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 1:28 PM.
Defendant Timothy A. Heinze in court with attorney Nathaniel Wilson Curry.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Curry informs the court this matter is close to resolution, and moves to continue for further negations.
No objection.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:46 AM.
Defendant Timothy A. Heinze in court with attorney Nathaniel Wilson Curry.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant enter plea "NOT GUILTY" all Count
Continue for status on 03/15/16

Case called at 9:22 AM.
Defendant Timothy A. Heinze in court.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reads charge portion onto the record, and finds probable cause for filing.
State request $1500.00 signature and no act/threats Angela Heinze.
Defendant informed of his right to counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Angela Heinze.
